comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: He's holding two things, a candle spike and a folding ruler. The man at right of shot also has a ruler. You know the ones with brass hinges, like this:

comment.author: 77199267@N03
comment._content: The guy with the galoshes is definitely not a labourer - look at that starched collar and the very clean overalls!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: Just popping in for one second (should be in the deep dark Stacks - but don't tell on me) - anyone care to investigate our Mr Meardon or Jackson or any other mine workers in the census? We know little or nothing about Mr Meardon... (at least I don't think any of you census-ised him up to now?)

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/79549245@N06/] The very best thing about this shot is the DOG:-). It is in such an unlikely spot that it is even more welcome.

comment.author: 77199267@N03
comment._content: Percival A Jackson, Architectural Draughtsman, Newtown Road, Waterford 1901 census www.census.nationalarchives.ie/pages/1901/Waterford/Water... a possibility?

comment.author: 77199267@N03
comment._content: No Meardon's in the census (or any variation I can find) but I found this William Meardon b. 30/7/1877 which would make him 29 in 1906 familysearch.org/pal:/MM9.1.1/FPQR-H57 And there were Meardon's near Macroom in Cork in 1827 titheapplotmentbooks.nationalarchives.ie/search/tab/resul...

comment.author: 77199267@N03
comment._content: Lots of disused shafts around Bunmahon on the 1905 OS Map - the lads here must have found a new seam maps.osi.ie/publicviewer/#V1,643440,599894,7,9

comment.author: 77199267@N03
comment._content: Here's a shaft not marked as 'disused' maps.osi.ie/publicviewer/#V1,643819,599208,7,9

comment.author: 77199267@N03
comment._content: Lot's more disused shafts close to where the 24/06/06 photo was taken maps.osi.ie/publicviewer/#V1,642784,598396,7,9
